description: Asset Management - The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities are identified and managed.
Business Environment - The organization's mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood.
Governance - Policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor regulatory, legal, risk, environmental requirements.
Risk Assessment - The organization understands the cybersecurity risk to operations, assets, and individuals.
Risk Management Strategy - Organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerances are established.
Identity Management and Access Control - Access to assets is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices.
Awareness and Training - Organization's personnel are provided cybersecurity awareness education.
Data Security - Information and records are managed consistent with risk strategy to protect confidentiality, integrity.
Information Protection Processes - Security policies, processes, and procedures are maintained.
Maintenance - Maintenance and repairs of industrial control and information system components are performed.
Protective Technology - Technical security solutions are managed to ensure security and resilience.
Anomalies and Events - Anomalous activity is detected and the potential impact is understood.
Security Continuous Monitoring - Information system and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events.
Detection Processes - Detection processes and procedures are maintained and tested.
Response Planning - Response processes and procedures are executed and maintained.
Communications - Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders.
Analysis - Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.
Mitigation - Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event and mitigate its effects.
Recovery Planning - Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained.
Improvements - Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned.
